result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chasity A Miller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 15cf189 and 15cf208 and 14cf237 Defendant Chasity A Miller in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status - PQ signed along with no vote signed.  14CF237 - enter a plea to Count 5 as amnd to felony Poss THC  - 2nd or subsequent offense  and  Count 7.   Count 6 -  DRI.   Count 8  is dismissed.  As to cases 15CF189 plead to count 1.   15CF208 - Count 1 DRI.  parties request a PSI and free to argue.  She pleads no contest to those three counts.  As it relates to 14CF237 - she admits she has a prior conviction.  15CF189 admit she is a repeater based on fel conviction.    Plea of nc know vol given, know vol waives rights, fact basis exist, commit crimes charged, finds guilty, convicted in 14cf237 - Possess THC - 2nd 961.41(3g)(e), and obstructing an officer and in 15CF189 convicted of fel bj as a repeater.  FELON - court orders a PSI - also consider the misdemeanor charge when preparing presentence - no modification of bail.  Pre-sentence due January 17, 2017 - short form -  author does not need to be here.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 31, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Chasity A Miller in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status is the same on each of these cases as before according to MLP.  14CF237, 15CF189, 15CF208.  DA asks court for a stc prior to the December trial date to see if we are still a number 2.  Miller can appear by phone for the next hearing.  MLP wants to relocate to Ironwood, MI needs a bail modification - no comment - motion is granted for modification and she can leave the SOW.  Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Chasity A Miller in court by phone with attorney Mark L Perrine appr in person.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 14CF237,15CF208 and 15CF189. Atty Perrine, no resolution request adj STC.  Ct comments on bail/bond modification. Ct questions on $ seized at time of arrest with Randeen Decorah. Atty Perrine comments.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
faxed request for phone appearnce to Sauk County
for Reduction of Bail

Defendant Chasity A Miller in court via phone  Saux Co jail with attorney Mark L Perrine in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF237,15CF189,15CF208. Atty states def waives rights to prelim in case 189 and 208. understands rights. no threat or force. Gives up right to prelim Ct finds probable cause the Def committed a fel in Ashland Co. Info's filed.  Do argn now. Atty and def will talk about property seized in the case with a co def. waives reading and stands mute to both charges. NG is now entered for her in each ct. Def is not asking for a speedy trial. did file motion for bail modifaction. Cash bail is set at $500 and because that is set they will not do huber priv. propsal for $200 cash and $3000 sign. ST does oppose this. Ct orders temp modify bail to a $3000 sign and all other conditions stay the same. Ct will go back to $500 by Sept 1, 2016. All none monitary conditions remain. Clerk set up to appear by phone.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 01:10 pm.
For Reduction of Bail
Set-up to appear by phone from Sauk County Jail. 608-355-3492

Defendant Chasity A Miller in court by phone with attorney Mark L Perrine appr in person.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def has not spoken with atty. Def to appr by phone (clerk set up)  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Def

Defendant Chasity A Miller in court, appr by phone from Sauk County Jail.   Kelly McKnight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def cannot get ahold of the public defenders, Ct contacts the PD office by phone, Ct questions def re financials. Receptionist at PD office def can do eligibilty form through local PD office. Def in custody until Sept. Clerk to set up def to appr by phone.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Chasity A Miller not in court. Housed in Sauk Co. Atty Perrine unsure if she has requested another atty. Def to appr by phone, clerk set up  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Chasity A Miller in court  via phone with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty via phone.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  3 cases before the court. 14Cf237, 15CF189, 15CF208. In the Sauk Co. jail. On a PO hold. Atty Moving to withdraw. No obj by atty. Motion to withdraw is granted.  Bail needs to be set. Warrants are canceled. Current address 810 Buffe Barabo WI 53913. In Jail Since March. Prior History. $500 cash bail.  Absol. sob. no B,T,LS. Pres as pres. no drug para. Tell court if there is a change of housing.  Bond covers all three cases. May appear by phone.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 01:10 pm.

Attorney M. Joseph Rafferty in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def in Sauk Co jail. Atty Rafferty files motion to withdraw. Ct will address when def next in court.
